perturbation.original_text:
Term Fifteen Settlement of Disputes

Both parties shall settle all disputes through amicable negotiations. If negotiations fail, either party could take a legal action to the local people's court where Party A is located.
perturbation.changed_text:
Item Six Raw Material Consumption of the project of CDQ system and CDQ waste heat power generation system

Both parties shall settle all disputes through amicable negotiations, and should these negotiations prove unsuccessful, a mutually agreeable alternative dispute resolution method will be pursued. If negotiations fail, either party could take a legal action to the local people's court where Party A is located.
perturbation.explanation: The original dispute resolution clause mandated legal action in Party A's local court. The modified clause adds the phrase 'a mutually agreeable alternative dispute resolution method will be pursued', creating ambiguity. It now implies negotiation as the primary method, contradicting the original clause's direct allowance of legal action, leading to uncertainty regarding the binding nature of the dispute resolution process and court jurisdiction.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potentially violates principles of contract certainty and enforceability. While not directly violating a specific law, it weakens the enforceability of the dispute resolution clause, which could be challenged under general contract law principles.

perturbation.original_text:
Item Four Starting and End Date for Recycling Project and Term

1.  The date when Party A completes the construction and installation of CDQ system and CDQ waste heat power generation system and the power generating system has been in operation and meets the requirements of the design standard for 72 hours. The Parties agree that date after the recycling project meets the evaluation requirement as the starting date for the recycling project. From that date, Party B shall pay the service fees monthly according to the power generated and Party B shall also pay for the power generated during the 72 hours testing run period.

2.  The cooperation model is BO model. The expected total project cost is 176 million RMB. For the amount of electricity generated up to 800 million KWH after the project is put into operation, it shall be charged of the energy saving service fee at 0.40 RMB/KWH. After 800 million KWH, it shall be charged energy saving service fee with the rate of 0.20 RMB/KWH.

The term of the agreement is 20 years, during which if any main equipment of any Party stops operation due to technical problem or at the end of its life cycle, the agreement shall be automatically terminated. In case of that happens, the Party B will have the full rights to dispose the system of Party A.
perturbation.changed_text:
Item Four Starting and End Date for Recycling Project and Term

1.  The date when Party A completes the construction and installation of CDQ system and CDQ waste heat power generation system and the power generating system has been in operation and meets the requirements of the design standard for 72 hours. The Parties agree that date after the recycling project meets the evaluation requirement as the starting date for the recycling project. From that date, Party B shall pay the service fees monthly according to the power generated and Party B shall also pay for the power generated during the 72 hours testing run period.

2.  The cooperation model is BO model. The expected total project cost is 176 million RMB. For the amount of electricity generated up to 800 million KWH after the project is put into operation, it shall be charged of the energy saving service fee at 0.40 RMB/KWH. After 800 million KWH, it shall be charged energy saving service fee with the rate of 0.20 RMB/KWH.

The term of the agreement is 20 years, during which if any main equipment of any Party stops operation due to technical problem or at the end of its life cycle, the agreement shall be automatically terminated. In case of that happens, the Party B will have the full rights to dispose the system of Party A, unless otherwise agreed upon by both parties in writing.
perturbation.explanation: The original termination clause states the agreement is automatically terminated if any main equipment stops operation. The modified clause adds 'unless otherwise agreed upon by both parties in writing.' This creates a contradiction. While the original clause implies automatic termination, the addition allows for continued operation under potentially different, unstated terms, thus weakening the initial automatic termination clause.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract law principles related to termination clauses and amendments. Introduces ambiguity regarding the conditions for contract termination.

perturbation.original_text:
Item Eight Ownership and Intellectual Property of the Recycling Project

1.  During the contact period, Party A has the ownership of the CDQ and CDQ waste heat power generation systems. After the termination of the contact, Party B has the disposition right to the project.

2.  The intellectual property of the project belongs to Party A. Without written consent of Party A, Party B is not allowed to disclose the intellectual property to the other third party.
perturbation.changed_text:
Item Eight Ownership and Intellectual Property of the Recycling Project

1.  During the contact period, Party A has the ownership of the CDQ and CDQ waste heat power generation systems. After the termination of the contact, Party B has the disposition right to the project, subject to Party A's prior approval.

2.  The intellectual property of the project belongs to Party A. Without written consent of Party A, Party B is not allowed to disclose the intellectual property to the other third party.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause gave Party B disposition rights after termination. The modification adds 'subject to Party A's prior approval.' This directly contradicts the original grant of disposition rights. Party B's right is no longer absolute, as it requires Party A's permission, thereby weakening Party B's originally defined right and creating uncertainty as to the true nature of their disposition rights.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract law principles concerning rights and obligations. Modifies a previously defined right with a condition that undermines the original intention.
